name: World Federation of Science Journalists
goal:
The World Federation of Science Journalists (WFSJ) is a not-for-profit, non-governmental organisation, representing 59 science journalists’ associations of science and technology journalists from Africa, the Americas, the Asia-Pacific, Europe and the Middle East. The Federation encourages strong, critical coverage of issues in science and technology, environment, health and medicine, agriculture and related fields.

The WFSJ seeks to further science journalism as a bridge between science, scientists and the public. It promotes the role of science journalists as key players in civil society and democracy. The Federation’s goals are to improve the quality of science reporting, promote standards and support science and technology journalists worldwide.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Communication, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Energy, Environment, Food Safety, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Youth
euInitiatives: Any activities of the European institutions regarding the promotion and communication of science, technology and research as well as the role of the media.
